snippet: Nickelodeon approached “Peter Rabbit” with the hopes that the series would have built-in appeal to parents who grew up with the blue-coated anthropomorphic bunny.
abstract: Nickelodeon changes some fundamental aspects of Beatrix Potter’s classic children's book The Tale of Peter Rabbit but keeps others in its new computer-animated series Peter Rabbit.
lead_paragraph: Nickelodeon approached “Peter Rabbit” with the hopes that the series would have built-in appeal to parents who grew up with the blue-coated anthropomorphic bunny.

headline.seo: Peter Rabbit on Nickelodeon for Christmas, Then as Series
headline.main: Bet Your Camomile Tea, Peter, You’re a TV Star Now
headline.print_headline: Bet Your Camomile Tea, Peter, You’re a TV Star Now
